content.description: Start by climbing directly up the arete to reach a horizontal on the arete (crux).  Continue up to reach the bolt.  From here, the climbing eases up a bit.  You can get another piece of gear before topping out.   Really nice rock and fun moves!
content.protection: 1 bolt, gear from .5" to 2.5".  There's a set of old bolts above Can I Touch It.  There's also a set of new bolts and quick links just behind the old bolts that you can use to lower off.
content.location: From the approach trail, head right to reach the corridor between the Main Block and the Mungo Jelly Block.  Pass through the corridor, Pinch Me I'm dreaming is the arete on the left before you reach the campfire ring.

content.protection: Natural pro, anchors at the top
Natural pro, achor at the top with Never Kissed On the Lips

content.location: Accross from Terror of Tiny Tom

content.description: Start just behind the large tree and climb up passing a horizontal to reach the first bolt.   Continue climbing up to reach the 2nd bolt.  The crux is the moves above the second bolt.  A small cam can be be placed before reaching the top.
content.protection: 2 bolts, cams < 1".  There are 2 bolt anchors above this climb just back from the edge (These are the original bolts).   There's also a new set of bolts with quick links about 10-15 ft back from the ledge to rap from.
content.location: From the approach trail, head right.  Walk through the corridor between the Main Block and the Mungo Jelly Block.  When you reach to open area with the campfire ring in front of you, Can I Touch It is to the left, about 10 feet to the right of the Pinch Me I'm Dreaming arete behind a large tree.

content.description: Although called the Main Block, this block is not the central block of The Knobs and only hosts a few routes.   These routes are very high quality.  You can easily climb up to the top of this block if you would like to setup a TR.  To access the top, head to the right corner of the block when standing at the campfire ring facing Can I Touch It.
